intro: Calycobolus cordatus, commonly known as the heartleaf calycobolus, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems. The botanical features of Calycobolus cordatus make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native habitat.
